conclusion: Determine the voltage U1 for complete collection of negatively charged particles by analyzing their motion under the electric field.
Identify the electric force on the particle as F = -αE.
Determine the acceleration of the particle as a = -αE/m using Newton's second law.
Analyze vertical motion and derive displacement d = -αEt^2/(2m).
Set d = 0 for total distance traveled to ensure particle reaches the plate, leading to t^2 = 0 (trivial).
Relate electric field E to voltage U1 as E = U1/d.
Substitute E into acceleration to get a = -αU1/(md).
Determine time t for horizontal travel as t = L/v0.
Substitute t into vertical displacement equation to get d = -αU1L^2/(2mdv0^2).
Set d = 0 for complete collection and solve for U1 to get U1 = 2mdv0^2/(αL^2).
